item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (41 points | 5 comments)
2. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (93 points | 36 comments)
3. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (41 points | 5 comments)
4. Knocking out one key gene leads to autistic traits (15 points | 12 comments)
5. Swift 6 (75 points | 20 comments)
6. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (78 points | 34 comments)
7. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (199 points | 14 comments)
8. TexTube: Chat with any YouTube video transcript in ChatGPT fast (12 points | 1 comment)
9. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (70 points | 50 comments)
10. WonderWorld: Interactive 3D Scene Generation from a Single Image (46 points | 9 comments)
11. The centrality of stupidity in mathematics (179 points | 93 comments)
12. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (164 points | 31 comments)
13. Things you should know about Windows Input, but would rather not (112 points | 64 comments)
14. Hezbollah pager explosions kill several people in Lebanon (277 points | 1044 comments)
15. Quote Origin: I had exactly four seconds and Google had told me it wasn’t enough (220 points | 93 comments)
16. Signatures of gravitational atoms from black hole mergers (81 points | 33 comments)
17. Storm Get a Wikipedia-like report on your topic (4 points | discuss)
18. Show HN: Finic – Open source platform for building browser automations (72 points | 49 comments)
19. Cloudflare Network Issues Affecting Service Reachability (23 points | 4 comments)
20. Race conditions in Linux Kernel perf events (48 points | 9 comments)
21. A Curried Composition Puzzle (73 points | 8 comments)
22. The theft of a Churchill portrait (47 points | 20 comments)
23. In 1926, TV Was Mechanical (72 points | 25 comments)
24. Show HN: Opik, an open source LLM evaluation framework (51 points | 9 comments)
25. IBM acquires Kubecost (50 points | 27 comments)
26. Krazam: High Agency Individual Contributor [video] (20 points | 1 comment)
27. Some remarks on the mathematical structure of the multiverse (17 points | 5 comments)
28. Lightweight radio transmitters on birds, bats and insects (49 points | 18 comments)
29. Not a Normal Field Trip (15 points | 4 comments)
30. An interactive core memory electronic kit (41 points | 2 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
